Below is a curated list of essential books, research papers, guidelines, collections, and online resources that have proven to be highly valuable.

## Medical statistics books

(@) Bland M. *An Introduction to Medical Statistics.* 4th ed. Oxford University Press; 2015.
(@) Chan BKC. *Biostatistics for Epidemiology and Public Health Using R.* Springer Publishing; 2015.
(@) Devore J, Peck R. *Statistics: The Exploration & Analysis of Data.* 7th ed. Cengage Learning; 2010.
(@) Field A, Miles J, Field Z. *Discovering Statistics Using R.* SAGE Publications; 2012.
(@) Held L, Rufibach K, Seifert B. *Medizinische Statistik: Konzepte, Methoden, Anwendungen.* 1st ed. Pearson; 2013.
(@) Kirkwood BR, Sterne JAC. *Essential Medical Statistics.* 2nd ed. Blackwell Science; 2003.
(@) Rosner B. *Fundamentals of Biostatistics.* 7th ed. Cengage Learning; 2010.

## Journal statistics collections

(@) Bland & Altman Statistics Notes. *BMJ.* <https://www-users.york.ac.uk/~mb55/pubs/pbstnote.htm>
(@) CRS Reproducibilty Notes. *Significance.* <https://www.crs.uzh.ch/en/resources/CRS-Reproducibility-Notes.html>
(@) Endgames by Philip Sedgwick. *BMJ.* [Pubmed link](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=Sedgwick+P%5Bau%5D+AND+BMJ%5Bjournal%5D&filter=years.2000-2025&sort=date&size=100)
(@) Guide to Statistics and Methods. *JAMA.* <https://jamanetwork.com/collections/44042/jama-guide-to-statistics-and-methods>
(@) Statistics at Square One. *BMJ.* <https://www.bmj.com/about-bmj/resources-readers/publications/statistics-square-one>
(@) Statistics for Biologists. *Nature.* <https://www.nature.com/collections/qghhqm>
